label: 官位
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: the system of ranks (I) and posts (kan) established by the ritsuryō codes, which essentially reconfigured the old royal domain based on the structures of uji and kabane. According to the kan'I logic of the codes, each post was attainable only by persons who had attained a given rank. Ranks were granted based on qualifications related to heredity, talent, and loyal service to the throne. Regulation of both ranks and posts thus empowered the throne. [律令、氏、姓]
